solution_line_template: If Ed has {num_dogs} dogs and {num_cats} cats he has in total {num_dogs}+{num_cats} = <<{num_dogs}+{num_cats}={not_fish}>>{not_fish} pets that are not fish
If Ed has twice as many cats and dogs combined he has {fish_multiplier}*{not_fish} = <<{fish_multiplier}*{not_fish}={num_fish}>>{num_fish} fish
Therefore, in total Ed has {not_fish}+{num_fish} = <<{not_fish}+{num_fish}={total_pets}>>{total_pets} pets
